children.name: Healthy Diets
Consumption and market management practices
children.label: NA

children.name: Presence-absence of dietary guidelines
children.definition: Policies or guidelines leading to diverse diets
children.label: Presence (1) or absence (0)
children.source: High Level Panel of Experts on Food Security and Nutrition (2017) Nutrition and food systems

children.name: Presense-absence of a national food composition table
children.definition: Resources to facilitate uptake of diverse diets
children.label: Presence (1) or absence (0)
children.source: High Level Panel of Experts on Food Security and Nutrition (2017) Nutrition and food systems

children.name: Sustainable Agriculture
Production management practices
children.label: NA

children.name: This indicator uses data from Zhang et al. (2015) on nitrogen use efficiency (NUE) per year at a national level. NUE is a measure of the amount of Nitrogen inputs that are not lost to the environment or remain in the soil, where Nitrogen inputs include fertiliser applications, manure applications, biological fixation and atmospheric deposition. Higher values represent increased NUE.
children.definition: Avoided over-use of artificial fertilizers or external inputs
children.label: kg N output per kg N input
children.source: Zhang, X. et al. (2015) Managing nitrogen for sustainable development. Nature. 528: 51-59

children.name: The 2018 Environmental Performance Index (EPI, https://epi.envirocenter.yale.edu/) ranks 180 countries on 24 performance indicators across ten issue categories covering environmental health and ecosystem vitality.  The Sustainable Nitrogen Management Index (SNMI) is one of these indicators. It is available for 2010 and covers 136 countries. SNMI represents the euclidean distance from 0, where 0 is the optimal sustainable nitrogen management. We take the inverse of the SNMI so that higher values represent improved nitrogen management.
children.label: 100/SNMI
children.source: Environmental Performance Index (2014); Accessed at: https://epi.envirocenter.yale.edu/

children.name: Mean percentage tree cover on agricultural land, calculated from the Global Tree Cover and Biomass Carbon on Agricultural Land Database (Zomer et al. 2016). Available at: http://glcf.umd.edu/data/vcf/
children.source: Zomer et al. (2016); Dataset available at: http://glcf.umd.edu/data/vcf/

children.name: Inverse of pesticide applications on arable land. We take the inverse of the pesticide applications so that higher values represent reduced pesticide use.
children.definition: Avoided over-use of chemical control mechanisms (pesticide applications)
children.label: 100/(kg pesticides per ha)

children.name: Percentage of agricultural land that is organic, including land under conversion to organic
Presence-absence of at least one subsidy or payment supporting sustainable agricultural practices
children.definition: Subsidies or payments to incentivise sustainable agricultural practices
children.label: Presence (1) or absence (0)

children.name: Percentage of arable land under conservation agriculture
Production diversity-based practices
children.label: NA

children.name: Percentage of agricultural land containing both cropland and pasture. This dataset was made by overlaying Ramunkutty (2008) 1 x 1 km pasture and cropland extent datasets to identify pixels containing both cropland and pasture, and representing these 'diversified' areas as a percentage of total agricultural land.
children.source: Ramankutty, N., A.T. Evan, C. Monfreda, and J.A. Foley (2008), Farming the planet: 1. Geographic distribution of global agricultural lands in the year 2000. Global Biogeochemical Cycles 22, GB1003, doi:10.1029/2007GB002952

children.name: Number of integrated landscape initiatives with pro-ABD investments. This indicator counts only those ILI's recorded in the Africa, Latin America or Asia global ILI reviews and that incorporate at least one of the following activities: promotion or introduction of new crops or crop varieties; Promotion of native food species and agrobiodiversity; Crop intensification with agroecological methods (e.g., organic production, conservation agriculture, no-till, integrated pest management, improved fallows, etc.); Livestock intensification with agroecological methods (e.g. improved grass and browse supply, management of water availability, etc.); Adoption or expansion of agroforestry; Implementation of laws or incentives to reduce the environmental impacts of agriculture; Implementation of soil conservation practices
children.definition: Maintenance or conservation of landscape complexity
children.label: Count
children.source: Global ILI reviews. Data obtained from Natalia Estrada-Carmona and Abby Hart (pers. comm.)

children.name: Current & Future Options
Genetic resource management practices
children.label: NA

children.name: Percentage of agricultural land that is organic, including land under conversion to organic
children.definition: Progress implementing the Convention on Biological Diversity: Agricultural land under organic agriculture

children.name: Percentage of arable land under conservation agriculture
children.definition: Progress implementing the Convention on Biological Diversity: Agricultural land under conservation agriculture

children.name: Proportion of indicators reported in FAO World Information and Early Warning System on Plant Genetic Resources for Food and Agriculture
children.definition: International reporting on plant genetic resources for food and agriculture
children.source: World Information and Early Warning System on Plant Genetic Resources for Food and Agriculture; Accessed at: http://www.fao.org/wiews/en/
